content.body: What's the 'modern' thinking around property setters and validation? On `<input>`, `min`, `max`, `step` just reflect, whereas `type` is limited to known values. Is there a 'right' way?
content.formatted_body: What's the 'modern' thinking around property setters and validation? On <input>, min, max, step just reflect, whereas type is limited to known values. Is there a 'right' way?

content.body: `max` on `<progress>` is limited to positive numbers
content.formatted_body: max on <progress> is limited to positive numbers

content.body: Jake Archibald: limited to known values is generally good; just reflect might be good too, depending on the type
content.formatted_body: Jake Archibald: limited to known values is generally good; just reflect might be good too, depending on the type

content.body: annevk: so do you think `step` should have checked the incoming value was parsable as a positive number or `"any"`?
content.formatted_body: annevk: so do you think step should have checked the incoming value was parsable as a positive number or "any"?
